turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hello! How are you doing today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I am well. How about yourself?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I am doing well thank you for asking. I wanted to talk to you about a charity that does great work called Save The Children. Have you ever heard of it?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I have not, but I am interested in hearing more about it. Can you tell me more?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries. They do amazing work in places where children do not have advocates for their well-being.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That sounds awesome. That's the sort of charity I would gladly donate to. They seem to be really making a difference in the world

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: You rock! Save the Children ensures that children have a right to health, education, and safety. For example: Syria in the first two months of 2018 In the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000+ children were killed or severely injured in violent situations. It is incredibly unfair to these children to experience such trauma at a young age, and thats where Save the Children steps in to help.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What are some things Save the Children have done for those children?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: In 2017, the charity reached 155 million children in the U.S. and worldwide. Would you like to know more about how the charity has stopped infectious diseases, lowered newborn fatality, stopped childhood hunger, provided education or provided disaster relief?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: yes please

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: To start, In the past three years the charity has treated more than 538,000 cases of pneumonia alone

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: oh that's great!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Next, Save the Children has provided food for more than 4.4 million children in the past year helping to reduce world hunger

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: that's great too. very important

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Also, around the world, nearly 400 million school-age children can't read or write. With the program instituted by the charity the literacy rates have been shown to increase by 30% and the children are 50% more likely to reach the 6th grade.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: wow. Save The Children is an excellent organization

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I am a very big fan, and I support the work they do 100%. Would you like to donate to this amazing effort today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: yes how can i donate

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children. How much do you like to donate to the charity?  You can choose any amount from $0.5 - $1.70

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I will donate $0.5
